title: A category of arrow algebras for modified realizability
abstract:
In this paper we further the study of arrow algebras, simple algebraic
structures inducing toposes through the tripos-to-topos construction, by
defining appropriate notions of morphisms between them which correspond to
morphisms of the associated triposes. Specializing to geometric inclusions, we
characterize subtriposes of an arrow tripos in terms of nuclei on the
underlying arrow algebra, recovering a classical locale-theoretic result. As an
example of application, we lift modified realizability to the setting of arrow
algebras, and we establish its functoriality.
